Entries.Sorren: When I was a kid, my parents hid little plastic eggs with candies inside. These local traditions feel quaint in comparison.$h#$e#Guess that was a pretty long time ago, now that I think about it.
Entries.Sorren_spouse: Hello, love. I saved you a seat if you wanna put your feet up for a bit.$4

Entries.Sorren: I'm not much of a dancer.
Entries.Sorren_spouse: You're the only person I wanna dance with, @.$l

Entries.Sorren: It's way too hot out. Marlon has the right idea staying back here.#$e#I put some mushrooms from the mines into the soup.
Entries.Sorren_spouse: I'm not avoiding you, I promise! It's just really, really hot out and the shade is cool.$3

Changes.LogName: Dance of the Moonlight Jellies - Dialogue

Entries.Sorren: The beach looks completely different at night with all these glowing lights.#$b#I'm actually really excited to see the moonlight jellies.$h
Entries.Sorren_spouse: Is it terribly cheesy if I say I'd rather watch you than the jellies?$

Entries.Sorren: Robin is a whiz with wood. I've learned a lot from her.#$e#Clint is great with metal, too. I supplied some of the ore for a couple pieces on display.
Entries.Sorren_spouse: What did you bring for the grange display? I'm excited to see!$h

Entries.Sorren: Hm? Oh, no, this one isn't mine. I would have come up with something a little less... goofy.#$e#Maybe next year I'll try to make an ice sculpture.
Entries.Sorren_spouse: This is my favorite festival. Do you want to make a snowman with me?$8

Changes.LogName: Feast of the Winter Star - Dialogue

Entries.Sorren: Thought I'd sit over here. Didn't want to get in the way of all the families.$3#$e#I'm fine on my own. Thanks for coming to say hi, though.
Entries.Sorren_spouse: You've made me feel like I belong, @. You're my family. I couldn't ask for a better present than that.$l
